lineage.Process: Buffer "Hi-Frequency Service Network" N:\CommDev\Research\Public\GIS\TIA\TIA_Eligible\QtrMile_HFServiceNetwork.shp "0.25 Miles" FULL ROUND LIST LINE_ID

Merge TOD_HFreq_Bus_Routes_Buffer;TOD_Express_Bus_Stations_Buffer;TOD_TIA_Stations_Buffer K:\Projects\CD\LCA\TODGrant\TODGrant_Areas.shp "LINE_ID "LINE_ID" true true false 10 Double 0 10 ,First,#,TOD_HFreq_Bus_Routes_Buffer,LINE_ID,-1,-1;NAME "NAME" true true false 254 Text 0 0 ,First,#,TOD_Express_Bus_Stations_Buffer,NAME,-1,-1,TOD_TIA_Stations_Buffer,Name,-1,-1;STATION "STATION" true true false 40 Text 0 0 ,First,#,TOD_TIA_Stations_Buffer,STATION,-1,-1"

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.4.4000

overview.eaover:
NAME: LRT or BRT transit station, high-frequncy express bus stop with significant passenger infrastructure, Hi-Frequency Transit Service Network (Local Bus Route)
TYPE: Type of LCATOD Eligible Station areas: High-Frequency Local Bus Route, or High-Frequency Express Bus Route

descript.abstract:
LCATOD Eligible Grant Areas are those areas that are included in the Livable Communities’ Transit Oriented Development (TOD) program that catalyzes development around light rail transit, commuter rail, and high-frequency bus transit stations by focusing on proposals that are:
- In a Transit Improvement Area (TIA) designated by the Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED) that includes a large portion of non-Federal land. - In TIA-eligible station areas located along light rail, commuter rail or bus rapid transitways operational by 2020. - Within 1/4 mile of any spot along high frequency local bus lines. - Within 1/2 mile of bus stops on high-frequency express routes with significant passenger infrastructure. TOD allows applicants to request resources from the following sources in one application:
- Tax Base Revitalization Account (TBRA) Contamination Cleanup Site Investigation TOD grants - helps applicants (1) determine the scope/severity of suspected contamination and (2) develop a clean up plan for environmental remediation of a site they have or will purchase. - TBRA Contamination Cleanup TOD grants - helps applicants who have recently completed their site investigation implement their cleanup plan and begin redeveloping their site. - Livable Communities Demonstration Account (LCDA) Pre-Development TOD grants - helps applicants define their projects by funding activities such as design workshops, redevelopment preparation, corridor or station area planning, development of zoning and land use tools, and strategizing for land banking and acquisition. - LCDA Development TOD grants - help applicants acquire or prepare sites, begin (re)development, and/or build infrastructure
descript.purpose: To view eligible areas for the LCATOD Grant program.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 county metropolitan area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.

citeinfo.title: Existing and planned transit stations; Hi-FrequencyPublic Transit Service Network; Park and Ride Lots

timeperd.current: Designated areas are accurate as of March 2014.

theme.themekey: Livable Communities, LCA, Transit Oriented Development, TOD, LCATOD, Transit, Transit stations, Station areas, TBRA, LCDA, Tax-Based Revitalization Account, Livable Community Demonstration Account

place.placekey: Blue Line, Red Line, Green Line, Green Line Extension, Red Line - Phase II, Northstar Commuter Rail, A Line Arterial BRT

procstep.procdesc: Existing or current understanding of future transit station locations were buffered 1/2 mile. Each station area was defined as an LCATOD Eligible Station Area. Those areas that fully or nearly fully exist within the Federal lands of Fort Snelling were excluded. Also a single station area along the Green Line Extension (Southwest Corridor) and select planned stations along the Red Line (Cedar Ave BRT) are also currently not included in the LCATOD Grant program. Each Hi-Frequency Transit Service line was buffered by 1/4 mile and included in the LCATOD Grant program. Select bus stops along high-frequency express routes with significant passenger infrastructure were buffered 1/2 mile and included in the LCATOD Grant program.

stdorder.ordering:
This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a map service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/. The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the "Services" link for this dataset in the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .
